newsitem.title: USA: McDonnell Douglas, Alydaar in Y2K agreement.
newsitem.headline: McDonnell Douglas, Alydaar in Y2K agreement.

text.p: Alydaar Software Corp, a software reengineering company, said on Monday that it entered a pilot program to provide Year-2000 services to McDonnell Douglas Corp using its SmartCode technology process.
The contract calls for Alydaar to correct various McDonnell Douglas programs comprised of different software languages that may not be Year-2000 compliant.

The Year 2000 problem arises from computer programs written in the 1970s and 1980s that read only the last two digits in the year. The 00 reading for 2000 would cause an error in some programs or could be interpreted as 1900.
SmartCode is Alydaar's core reengineering technology and is designed to automatically correct millions of lines of code per month.
